item.title: Making appropriations for the Department of Veterans Affairs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2005, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Appropriations, and in addition to the Committee on Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.text: Motion to Discharge Committee filed by Mr. Edwards. Petition No: 108-14. (Discharge petition text with signatures.)
Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

On 10/5/2004, a motion was filed to discharge the Rules Committee from consideration of H.Res.788 a resolution providing for the consideration of H.R.4423. A discharge petition requires 218 signatures for further action. (Discharge Petition No. 108-14: text with signatures.)

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4423) making appropriations for the Department of Veterans Affairs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2004.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 4423) making appropriations for the Department of Veterans Affairs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2004, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
